Articles.Content:
I'm so disappointed...

My Jebediah died so many times in the sandbox... everytime i bring back to life with "revert to launchpad" i never know that he could die forever

I lost my precious friend and there are NO MOD to bring he with me again!!

He lost his life finding yet another bug in the program... he did a low pass on the sun and at around 1300 meters from it's surface his landing ship exploded due to overheat on engines (they overheat instantly)

altimeter show around 1300 meters but it looks like the surface was lot of km away!!!!!

no "return to launchpad" was available (yet another bug)
Jeb is stranded, having climbed into the cockpit of a plane that ran out of fuel that was trying to save him after crashing in his plane doing a survey on the north pole.
He died during the reentry of STS-1
On Laythe, manning the base there with 5 other Kermans, until the day that I am able to design a lander that can pick all 6 of them up.
Mine is on a mission to Gilly, together with Bill and Bob.
On his way to a high-speed lithobraking attempt on Lay... Ah, who am I kidding, Kerbin. I havn't made past Mun
At home, waiting for the next rocket to be build.
On a trajectory out of the system.
Ferrying rookies on a cruise around Mun/Minmus to get them some experience

Currently sitting on the command bridge atop my fleet's flagship which just recently managed to get to laythe (had to drag 2 refueling ships alongside it to keep it going). I dont know why, but ive always used jeb on the best and largest capital ship i have around at any given time. And provided said ship has enough room for them, i also place bill and bob on the same ship for repair duties and science stuff (although a warship doesnt really do much if any science, unless exploding hordes of pirates is science).

Floating above Kerbin aboard my StarLab space station.

I decided the main 3 Kerbals were safer there than they would be in most other places, though I guess they'll have to come home sooner or later.
Currently piloting an LV-N powered survey vessel to Jool to complete a Visual Survey contract. After hearing "Trust me, I'm an engineer!", Jeb decided to take Bob along on this trip instead of Bill.

He is in Duna Station on 350 km equatorial orbit after Duna system investigation mission. They should have started return trip already, but I got a very good contract to grind money if I make a Kuarg Bioactivity experiment around Duna. I even had necessary laboratory modules to do that (Station Science mod). So, I ordered that their return is delayed to next return window. Now Jeb and three other crew members wait a Kuarg Bioactivity research unit and TAC supplies for prolonged mission from Kerbin. Maybe they can do some extra landings to Duna and Ike during waiting. There are some unvisited biomes left and plenty of fuel.

Commanding the San Kerbsisco Drive Yards in Minmar Polar Orbit, awaiting the arrival of the planetary lander to begin harvesting resources from Minmus to begin constructing the yards to their full glory.
At the astronaut complex, because Extraplanetary Launchpads work is affected by the stupidity rating, and Jeb didn't make the cut. yes i'm calling him stupid
He is on a house boat off Insular Island relaxing, while a Minimus mission is being built. JEB is happy spending his day in an open MK3 cargo bay watching the clouds roll by.

On a rag tag collection of craft all docked together with spares, on it's way to rendezvous with a return from Jool craft for the 20 something Kerbals I have around Laythe.

Why? The game is bugged and I need to return all the Kerbals to redo my save (seems 0.90 hates old saves... and new saves and any save with a living/flying Kerbal in it).
On his way back to Kerbin from a solo surface mission to Gilly, where he just earned his fifth star.

Floating off the coast of the Space Center in a plane with no wings or engines. I was trying to recreate a scene from a book I read and failed, but didn't crash hard enough to destroy any part of the fuselage...just the wings and engines.

He's on Duna with a crew that got tired of his jokes and forced him to land by threatening to terminate his Minmus icecream rations. Too bad they didn't realize that after landing they couldn't get much further away from him and his jokes. Only a year to go before the return window is open.
Currently piloting a rescue craft a few hundred meters from its target. Why so close, but not completed? Because I had a crash :/
My Jeb is current;y starting a clone army of himself on minmus while the rest of the agency flies in more parts for my minmus base. They recently just got a karbonite drill.
Davy Jone's Locker...
Cooling off after a successful Minmus expedition and preparing for a Duna one. I only use Jeb.

Safe in the Astronaut Complex.

I know I'm lame.
